lines.text:
[speaking of Machine Gun and his pals]
Those are the horniest little guys this side of TJ.
TJ?
Tijuana, man
Hey, why do they call him Machine Gun?
I don't know, everybody calls him that. Claims he holds the international record for jerking off.

[laughst]
When I was his age, I thought I held it.
Yeah, we all held it. I think he holds it more.
What do you do?
I work for a doctor in Century City.
Oh, are you a nurse?
No, a receptionist.
Well, what kind of doctor?
Gynecologist.

[scoffs]
I hear there's a lot of openings in that field.
Oh, no, actually it took me a long time to find.
Then things must be pretty tight.
Yeah, they really are.
See that guy in the blue over there?
The old guy?
Yeah. Two ladies complained he was wagging his weenie at them.

[at job interview]
That blond Adonis image you're talking about, that doesn't fit anymore. There's a lot of training involved. A lot of responsibility. A lot of discipline. I do more P.R. work out on that beach on a summer day than you do in here in a month. But you're right. Saving lives isn't selling cars.
Hey, what do you do during the winter?
Same thing I do during the summer.
Yeah? Must get lonely, huh?
Ah, beats selling encyclopedias.
Have you made love with many girls?
What, are you writing a book?
[smiles]
No, just curious.
[a beat]
Have you?
Yeah, a few. Have you made love with many boys?
Just once. I didn't really like it, though. We didn't really know what we were doing.
You got lots of time. A woman doesn't hit her prime till she's thirty.
Yeah, by then I wanna be really good at it.
I love to throw bastards like that off my beach.
Money isn't everything.
It's most things, believe me.
Hey, you wanna stop for a beer?
Hey man, I'd like to, but I got a little, eh, stewy friend coming in tonight.
Yeah? Is it true what they say about stewardesses?
Yeah. And nurses and secretaries and schoolteachers.

[laughs]
What do they say about schoolteachers?
Ah, they make you do it over and over and over again, till you get it right.
